conclusion: The problem involves a square wire frame with side length L and capacitance C, placed in a magnetic field weakening at rate k.
The image shows a square wire frame forming a capacitor, half in a magnetic field.
The rate of change of magnetic flux is -kL^2.
The induced electromotive force is kL^2.
The current in the loop is kCL.
The direction of the current is determined by the induced electromotive force and loop orientation.
The induced electromotive force is kL^2 and the current is kCL.
